subject: Investing
title: SEP IRA for Self-Employed Savers
description: A quick, practical guide to SEP IRA for Self-Employed Savers.

hook.text: A freelance designer contributed $66,000 to a retirement account in a single yearâ€”all tax-deductible.

buildup.text: A SEP IRA lets self-employed workers contribute up to 25% of net income, with a high annual cap.

discovery.text: The 2025 SEP IRA limit is $70,000â€”far more than a traditional IRA's $7,000 ceiling.

twist.text: There's no Roth option. Every dollar goes in pre-tax, meaning you'll owe taxes on withdrawals.

climax.text: Setup takes minutes and costs nothing. It's the simplest big-dollar retirement tool for solopreneurs.

punchline.text: Self-employed? A SEP IRA lets you be your own generous employer.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of a SEP IRA over a traditional IRA?
